Figueroa Lugo | num_employees = | parent = | divisions = | subsid = | homepage = | footnotes = | intl = }} '''La Mallorquina''' is a restaurant in [[San Juan, Puerto Rico|San Juan]], [[Puerto Rico]] that specializes in the making of Puerto Rican and [[Spain|Spanish]] food dishes such as asopao, [[gazpacho]], [[arroz con pollo]], [[paella]] and [[crème caramel|flan]]. It opened its doors in 1848 and has been run by the Rojos family since 1900<ref>{{cite book|last=Porter|first=Darwin |coauthors=Danforth Prince|title=Frommer's Portable Puerto Rico|publisher=Frommer's|year=2007|edition=4|page=87|isbn=978-0-470-10052-3|url=http://books.google.ca/books?id=vQrgbF6kymMC&pg=PA87|accessdate=2009-02-08}}</ref> and some historians claim that La Mallorquina is the first eating establishment in Puerto Rico.<ref>Ortiz, Yvonne. A Taste of Puerto Rico: Traditional and New Dishes from the Puerto Rican Community. Penguin group, 1997. P. 3</ref> The restaurant's original owners, Antonio Vidal Llinás and others, came from [[Palma de Mallorca]], [[Spain]]; that's why they named their restaurant ''La Mallorquina,'' which loosely translated into [[English language|English]] means ''The Woman from Mallorca.'' Puerto Rico's first elected governor, [[Luis Muñoz Marín]], was also one of the famous people to visit the restaurant.<ref>[http://books.google.co.uk/books?id=SMjxjXywjcIC&pg=PA77&dq=la+mallorquina+san+juan#v=onepage&q=la%20mallorquina%20san%20juan&f=false San Juan: memoir of a city]</ref> ==See also== *[[Puerto Rican cuisine]] *[[Spanish cuisine]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Mallorquina}} [[Category:Companies based in San Juan, Puerto Rico]] [[Category:1848 establishments]] [[Category:Restaurants in Puerto Rico]] {{restaurant-stub}}
